title: What I have to know if I want to be an IB intern at Goldman Sachs, JP Morgan or Morgan Stanley? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you go to a target school, make sure to go to all the networking events on campus. The recruiting teams spend a significant amount of time looking at who attended these events, and it’s an important mechanism in the filtering process. Make sure to speak with the recruiting team and take every opportunity to get to know them better. If you DON’T go to a target school, hustle hustle hustle. Show up at another school’s event—people love that level of effort and underdog mentality. In either case, by no means will simply applying on the website ever be sufficient.Focus on your story. Interviews are typically made or broken in the first 120 seconds. Work on your story. Figure out the main points. Cut out useless information that doesn’t sell you. Video tape yourself saying your story. Spend hours on this and don’t underestimate how quickly interviewers will make a decision on your candidacy. Your story should include WHY you want to do banking. The interviewer is trying to assess if you know what you’re getting yourself into and you’ve thought through this career decision.Know technicals 100%. There’s only a few technical/quantitative tests a banker can throw at you. (1) DCF, (2) accounting, (3) understanding of comparables. These concepts are simple at a high level, but take some time to understand deeply. When articulating how to do a DCF, the interviewer isn’t looking for a high level answer, they are looking for a line by line understanding of the formula and how each line can impact the ultimate value. Comparables are similarly nuanced. You may understand mechanically how they work, but there is significant nuance in applying them. Why use EV / Revenue vs. EV / Free Cash Flow? How do multiples vary by industry? Fluency is different than knowledge. Try to be fluent.Extracurricular interest in finance (e.g., examining a portfolio) is helpful if you REALLY know what you’re talking about. Otherwise don’t fake it. IB firms are looking for hungry athletes who are intelligent that they can train. Prepare intelligently by focusing on the 3 items above and don’t worry so much about demonstrating that you live and breathe finance. Non-intuitively, it can be a drawback because the interviewer might expect that you’d be disappointed when the job isn’t as glamorous as you expected.
